turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Hey, you don't need all this just to go on vacation. Unless this ain't for going on vacation...

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: I'm through, Xander.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I can see that. Why?

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: You run around with maniacs jumping motorcycles in the desert, you break 36 bones crashing wave runners and snowboarding off cliffs, all with no health insurance... It's insane, I can't take it anymore.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm having fun, what's the problem?

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: You have all this talent, and you waste it. You won't take a single endorsement deal. Meanwhile those other guys have their own video games! But no, you've got too much "integrity" for that.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I don't wanna go mersh, you know that. But hey, if this is about money...

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: French Polynesia? This wouldn't last us a week in a cheap hotel. Do you know how expensive it is down there?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Alright, so I'll get more.

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: It's not about the money, X! You never plan for anything. I can't live like that anymore, I need some stability.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Well if you're bailing, I guess I'd better give you your surprise now.

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I was gonna wait till the islands, but...

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: You're serious?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Of course I'm serious. I bought it, didn't I?

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: This is so typical. I can't believe you. I've barely seen you for the last three weeks and now this? Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I don't know. I thought this is what you wanted. You want stability, here it is.

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: You can't just propose to me out of nowhere. You think that's going to solve our problems? I'm sorry, X. It was a kick for a while, but it's over. You're just not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You're not exactly "going anywhere" yourself.

turns.speaker: SKY
turns.text: You're wrong about that. I'm heading out that door right now.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: Sit down.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I've been on a plane for twelve hours, I think I'll stand.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: My name is Slovo, Czech secret police. When you are here you are under my jurisdiction, you take my orders, you do what I say. If you become any kind of an inconvenience, I'll shoot you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Here we go again.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: You're here because your government is putting pressure on my government. This is an internal affair, a Czech affair, that you are interfering with. I will warn you once: Don't shit in my lawn. Get whatever information your government seeks and get our.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: First of all, you should kill whoever sold you that suit. Two, I don't wanna be here either, so just step off. Three, if you had the authority to shoot me you would've done it by now, so just ease up on the machismo, bitch. Now that we've got that sorted out, I'm gonna get some rest.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Nice hops.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: The corner. Anarchy 99.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: I'll leave you two alone to talk.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Yeah, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Dude, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: You killed me, remember? Now I have to hide out here with you. Where have you been?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I found something big enough for us to take these guys down with. They've got a of nerve agent they're gonna unleash.

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: Is this what you're looking for?

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: Sorry, "dude".

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What's the deal?

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: Oh come on, don't feel bad. You got played, so what? You're new at this. Did you think you could just stroll into this business one day and have all the angles figured out?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Why you dogging me up?

turns.speaker: SLOVO
turns.text: They came and found me. They said they'd kill me unless I help them. Plus they offer me a lot of money. No big deal. These things happen. Dump your gun on the floor.

turns.speaker: VIRG
turns.text: What's so damn funny?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Been to any good diners lately?

turns.speaker: VIRG
turns.text: Heads up, man. What's this thing on my back?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: A parachute. This does not argue well.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Who's writing this dude's dialogue?

turns.speaker: VIRG
turns.text: He's a pretty good actor, though.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Help me with this guy.

turns.speaker: VIRG
turns.text: It's like you said, every man for himself.

turns.speaker: VIRG
turns.text: They're all over the place! What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Looks like we're in the middle of the drug war.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That's the guy.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: This pizda? Never seen him before.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Who you workin' for? What do you do for a living, dickhead?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Cops. Like a plague. No matter how many you pay there's always another with his hand out. How did you pick him out?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: He flashed his badge to half the bar when he bought his drink.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Whatever you want, the rest of the night, consider it on the house.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Thanks, but I'm here on business. I heard you're the G around here. I'm looking for some cars, expensive ones. A lot of them.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Sorry, man, don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I'm talking about the sports cars that disappear off the docks in Genoa and wind up here. If you don't know about 'em, who does?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: I remember that one where you jump the motorcycle over the freeway at rush hour.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: When else are you gonna do it?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: We seen all your shit! So you want cars? We get whatever cars you need. What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Ferrari's, Lamborghini's... high end pasta rockets. Ten to start.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Don't look at me, X, she handles all the details.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: It'll work faster if I have an account number.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Very nice. I'm impressed.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: I'm somewhat less so. We seem to have a bit of a problem...

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I had to inspect the merchandise first.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: This is a gift. From me to you.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: What's going on, my friend?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You tell me! You got a sniper up there or what?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: He's not with us, Xander. He must be with you.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Bullshit! You get your boy off that roof or I swear to God I'm gonna give you another hole to breathe out of.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: I don't believe it! You can't shoot a cop in the middle of the street!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Had to do what I had to do.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Total chaos, man! Welcome to Anarchy 99!

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What's "Anarchy 99"?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: It's all this craziness! It's what we've been living since 99, when we left the Army. One of our brothers died in Grozny and we said the hell with this shit. What for? He dies for what? Politics? Who's politics? Not ours.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You wanna see my politics?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Screw the world. If I'm gonna die for something, it better be bitches and money.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: That's what I'm talking about, man! That's why Anarchy 99 was born.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: To us it means no walls, no speed limits, no jails. It's everybody does what he wants. People think democracy is freedom but they don't have a clue. There's an old punk song. It says: "America stands for freedom, but if you think you're free..."

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: "...try walking into a deli and urinating on the cheese". 'Anarchy Burger' by the Vandals.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You got it, man. It's stupid but it's true. True freedom is when you do whatever you want anytime you want. That's when you know you're living, man.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: How you gonna do that with government and rules everywhere?

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Easy. You get enough money that you grow an ass big enough for the whole world to kiss.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: You got a great set-up here Yorgi. You really know how to live.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: It's a beautiful town, Prague. It's been good to me.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I've been here before, when I was a kid. My old man was in the service, we used to live on the Army base in Hamburg.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You, an Army brat? I don't see that one at all. Did you join the service as well?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Hell no. My dad was a straight up tin soldier. Somehow he pissed this general off and got himself dishonorably discharged. Had a court martial and everything. The charges were total bullshit, so he was sure he'd get his name cleared, but it didn't happen.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Connections and politics, it's the same everywhere.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: My old man, he bought into the system, and it screwed him. So he swallowed a bullet. Me, I don't believe in nothing I can't see and touch.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: I've got meetings this afternoon, I've got to get some sleep. Just pick a girl.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: That's alright, I'm kinda tired.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You want to insult me? This is my hospitality. Pick one.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: That was for Anders.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Don't forget goatee boy. I greased him up on the diamond run.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: And you. Why do you have such a problem staying away, my friend? Did you miss us that much?

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: I wanted to get the hell out of Prague before Silent Night falls.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Not bad, man, not bad. You put things together quick. Prague it is.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: What's the gimmick, Yorgi? That's the part I don't get. You gonna hold the world hostage with your gas bombs? I didn't think you were dumb enough to go with that hack cliche.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You think I'm after money? I told you, my friend. Anarchy. Time for a change. Money is good, but for true freedom you have to get rid of the rules themselves.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: So all by yourself, you're going to destroy every government; in the world.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Easier than that, buddy. I'll get them to destroy each other. You kill an entire Peace conference, someone is going to have to pay. Then our friend Ahab continues down the river to the ocean and begins his world tour. London, Cairo, Beijing... Pretty soon everyone's involved. These guys bomb those guys, those guys invade these guys. Soon the whole world is like your wild West cowboy days. No rules, no law, everybody free to do what they want.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Including rape, pillage, murder.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Sure, if that's what you want. Why not? It's all human nature. So we just have to launch our baby and wait for the decline and fall of civilization as we know it.

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: And here I thought "anarchy" was just something cool to put on a Tshirt.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: Come on, Xander. You used to stand for something. What happened to you, man? I thought you'd get it.

turns.speaker: YORGI
turns.text: You both could have been a part of it. You could have ridden with us into a new day, the dawning of a new age of --

turns.speaker: XANDER
turns.text: Oh just shoot us already. I'm sorry I asked.

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: The neuro-filter acts like a surge protector, regulating the infinite flow of information from Cerebro to the Professor's mind.  It's what keeps him from being crushed by the consciousness of millions.

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: Thomas Edison knew how to make the light bulb.  He had the energy source. He had the vacuum.  But he didn't have the filament.  He tried metal after metal but nothing would hold to power.

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: ... until he found tungsten.

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: I wish I could go.

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: We all do.

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: Storm.  Try to look for the highest vantage point. From what I can figure, he'll need to gain as much altitude as possible to blanket the island.  It is my feeling that Magneto has to--

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: Beast.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Can the Professor repair his own mind?

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: I'm afraid without Cerebro's help, he won't have the strength to heal himself -- And without the neuro- filter... there's no Cerebro.

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: It appears as though Magneto has built a machine which somehow triggers the mutator gene in normal human beings. And he is using Adamantium as its core.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Its core?

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: Correct...  Apparently, Adamantium is the only metal strong enough to hold the energy this machine produces.  He used the Adamantium in Logan's dog tag to test it on the Senator.  And I assume now he plans to use the rest of Logan's skeleton for a larger demonstration.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: For what purpose?

turns.speaker: BEAST
turns.text: Yes -- Only there's a problem.  The mutator gene is not responding to the radiation the way it would in mother nature.  It's forcing the body's cells to replicate thousands of times faster than they're accustomed to.  The Senator's body is literally burning itself out.  Scott -- this machine kills people and I don't think Magneto realizes it.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: So where do you think he's planning this larger demonstration?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Scott.. I -

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I don't like him being here.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: You saw what happened tonight.  You think Magneto won't come after him again.  You think he won't come here if necessary.  This is a school, for God's sake.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: If Magneto is planning to use Logan for some terrible purpose it's our responsibility to do something.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: His vital signs are weak and getting weaker.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: He's already losing control of his vitals.  Respiratory.  Cardiovascular. Unless we manage to replace the filter by tomorrow morning, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: We have to find Magneto.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: No.  I'm...  I don't know if we can do this without Charles.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Hey.  I'm sorry.  About Logan.  I was jealous.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Well, I think that's perfectly understandable.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I'll tell you one thing though.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: He calls me sport one more time, and I'll blow a watermelon-sized hole through him.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Radar Stealth Mode checks out.  All right, there'll be less security north of the George Washington Bridge.  I'm taking her down.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Into the Hudson?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I'm going to assume that means that the Secret Service is out of commission.  Jean, can you raise me up there?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: It's too far.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Storm, Rogue, -- you take the south entrance.  Jean and I will go in here.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Jean... can you?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm not strong enough.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Inspiring -- Now what am I doing here?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I wanted to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: How long have you been in Alaska?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I don't remember.  Is that what you wanted to ask me?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I've served with men like you before. Methodical.  Systematic -- Naive.  You know what happens to those men in a real fight?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: You know, you --

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Shut up.  I got no interest in you, Xavier,  or your... X-Men.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'm o.k.  I'm o.k.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Sure you are, sport.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Anything else I can get you?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Some cigars.  Case of beer.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: There's no smoking or drinking on the school grounds.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I won't light the cigars - how about that?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I'll see what I can do -- You should get some sleep.  Even with your healing ability, you're going to be hurting for a while.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What if I like the pain?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: The Professor said you were a solider. Actually, I believe he used the word mercenary.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Yeah?  Well I don't like to talk about my past.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Maybe, the Professor could help you with that.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: By reading my thoughts?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: If necessary.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What if they're naughty?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You should always work with a spotter.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: He's busy right now.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I was thinking maybe you and me could go into town.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Were you now?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What do you say?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Not interested.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Let go.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Suit yourself.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: He's uptight.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: He takes his work seriously.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: He takes himself seriously.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: What is it you're failing to get at? Are you interested in me?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Logan, do you see this ring?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I've seen a lot of rings.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Yeah, I'll bet you have.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You're avoiding the question I posed to you at the beginning of the hearing, Ms. Grey.  Three words: Are mutants dangerous?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I am avoiding a question that is decidedly loaded, Senator.  The wrong person behind the wheel of a car can be dangerous.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Ms. Grey -- you work at a school for mutants in Westchester, New York.  Can you tell the members of this committee what exactly you are teaching these mutants?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Math.  History.  Science.  English. Athletics --

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You wouldn't happen to be teaching them how to use their powers to --

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Control, Senator...  we teach them control.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: This was taken by a state police officer in Secaucus, New Jersey.  A man in a minor altercation literally melted the car in front of him.  I don't know where you come from, Ms. Grey, but where I come from, you don't go melting people's cars when they cut you off.  You do it the old fashioned way -- you give 'em the finger.  But what you presume to tell this committee -

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I presume nothing, I am here to tell you that in time, the mutator gene will activate in every living human being on this planet.  Perhaps even your children, Senator.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I can assure you, there is no such creature in my genes.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Dr. Grey.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Senator?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm sorry to come here, Ms. Grey.  I was afraid if I went to a hospital, they would...

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Treat you like a mutant?  We are not what you think.  Not all of us.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Tell it to the ones that did this to me.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: The mutant gene tells the body when it needs to change.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I can assure you, there is no such creature in my genes.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You... wha... Who are you... Where is Henry?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Mr. Guyrich has been dead for some time Senator.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You mutant bastards...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Whatever you do to me... no matter what you'll make me right.  Every word I have spoken will be confirmed.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Gosh, I hope so.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: The intention of registration act -

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: INTENTION?  Intention, Senator?  We are talking about mankind here.  His fear.  It is only a matter of time before mutants will be herded into camps.  Studied for weaknesses.  And eventually wiped off the face of the Earth.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What is it you intend to do to me?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Let's just say, God works too slowly.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: I do love a good check mate.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Come with me and I'll let her live.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You think I care about her?  I'm the only one who's sure to walk out of here.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: You're backstage at the encore of creation.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: In the road to survival, there is always sacrifice Logan.  We are the future... not them.  We must protect ourselves.  After tonight, when the leaders of the world return home -- They will return as brothers, as mutants... and our cause will be theirs.  This is survival, I know you understand that, Logan... or is it Wolverine?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What am I doing here?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I brought you here so that you would be safe from Magneto.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: A very powerful mutant who for some reason has taken an interest in you. I'm not sure why, but until we find out, I must ask you to stay.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Forty-eight hours, old man.  But if you cross me, I won't feel any guilt about what I do to you.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: The point of what?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: This.  This whole God damn thing.  Making yourselves into some sort of "team" of super-powered freaks. Teaching wayward mutants about classical literature.  For what?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: The point is to step into a more evolved position of social responsibility.  To recognize that there is a world out there and that we mutants are as much a part of it as normal human beings.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What if it never happens?  What if they're so afraid of us that we become the enemy? -- This place is gonna be one giant cemetery.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Now that's Magneto talking.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No.  That's me talking.  And you know what?  It's only been thirty-two hours and you still have no idea what this guy wants with me.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I believe he wants you for your Adamantium.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: To find Rogue.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: The brainwaves of mutants are quite different than those of the average human being.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You designed this yourself?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Actually, Magneto helped me put it together.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: He helped you?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: We were friends once...  But that was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I've found her, Westchester Mall.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'll go.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Don't you knock?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: They're all asking how you're doing. Are you feeling up to saying hello to everyone?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Actually I'm feeling up to leaving.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Why?  You have a home here now, if you want it.  Everyone will...

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What?... miss me?  Charley, I'm gonna walk out the front door and trust me, it won't be soon enough for everyone here.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Why is everybody up at sunrise?

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: The sun is setting, Logan.  You've been asleep for nineteen hours.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: What did she do to me?

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: She borrowed your power to save her life.  When she touches someone, she absorbs their strengths -- their gifts.  In your case -- your ability to heal.  That's why she keeps her body covered.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I felt like she almost killed me.

turns.speaker: STORM
turns.text: If she held on any longer she could have.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: And you think it helps calling her Rogue?

turns.speaker: SABRETOOTH
turns.text: I lost him.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: SABRETOOTH
turns.text: It was Xavier's people.  They knew.

turns.speaker: SABRETOOTH
turns.text: Is that what you're looking for?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: A piece.  Only a piece.

turns.speaker: SABRETOOTH
turns.text: Is it enough?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Enough for a test.

turns.speaker: SABRETOOTH
turns.text: I'll find him.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: ALIVE.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: I'll never understand your regard for them, Charles.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: And I'll never understand terrorists.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: I am trying to save our kind, Charles. You should do the same.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Not at the cost of lives, Max.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: The two in Alaska.  Just how do you people manage to be in the right place at the right time?  Still tinkering with Cerebro?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: What do you want with him?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Is that so?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Still trying to make the world safe for our kind.  Still trying to find a way to introduce ourselves -- definitively.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: You definition of definitive was always a bit extreme for me, Max. What is it like these days?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Let's just say that I am out to make some radical changes.  Now come on Charles.  For old times sake, for your sake...  Leave him to me.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: If I could make you understand.  If you could just be made to see it the way I do.  The way it's going to be.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: The way what is going to be?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: I'm going to change the world with or without you as a witness, Charles.  And this one gets a front row seat.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: What do you mean to do?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: This checkmate goes to you.  I didn't want to hurt anyone.  But you leave me no choice.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: WHAT DO YOU MEAN TO DO?

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: I wouldn't really have let you die, you know.  I just needed...

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: Doesn't it ever wake you in the middle of the night?  The feeling that some day, some day very soon, they will pass that foolish law - or one just like it - and they will come for you and your children?  Take you all away?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: It does indeed, Max.

turns.speaker: MAGNETO
turns.text: And what do you do when you wake up to that?

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I feel a great swell of pity for the poor soul who comes to that school again looking for trouble.

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: Excuse me, Mr. Waldman -- excuse me for interrupting.  But is Frederick, then...a medical doctor?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS WALDMAN
turns.text: Yes, my dear, he is.

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: And has he achieved...any special degree of eminence?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS WALDMAN
turns.text: He is the fifth leading authority in his field.

turns.speaker: ANASTASIA
turns.text: Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS WALDMAN
turns.text: Herr Falkstein -- you must go at once and present Dr. Frankenstein with all the details of his inheritance.  The estate will provide for your journey.

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: Frederick Frankenstein?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: You have the wrong house.

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: And who might you be?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Dr. Frederick Fronkonsteen.

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: The grandson of Victor 'Fronkonsteen'?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: What was your grandfather's name?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Victor Frankenstein.

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: Forgive me for intruding so late at night, Herr Baron.  But an ugly rumor has it that there are strange goings on in this castle.  These good citizens are ready to rip you from limb to limb unless you can offer some rational explanation for their fears.  How say you?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Ugly, vicious rumous.

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: They say, also, that you have recreated the horrible monster who, for so many years, has haunted and terrorized the God-fearing people of this village.  What say you to that?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Poppycock!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I think we all need a good night's sleep.  Why don't we meet next week and thrash this thing out?

turns.speaker: BURGOMEISTER
turns.text: Now wait a minute!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Where did you get this cauliflower?

turns.speaker: CARLSON
turns.text: From your office, sir.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Didn't you prepare it with the celery before my lecture?

turns.speaker: CARLSON
turns.text: Yes, sir.  But I must have taken the wrong one when we came up.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Are you trying to make me look like an idiot?
